page.title: 06THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE (cont)
page.content:
Bryant and May make most of the matches sold in Britain. In their factories at Liverpool, Glasgow and Gloucester they make over 58 million matches each year. They make two types of matches. The first type will only strike on the box,while the second can be struck on any rough surfaces.Poplar trees are used for the match-stalks bacause they grow quickly. The poplar wood will also burn easily because it is a soft wood. Although Bryant and May is not in Speke, it employs people from Speke.It is known locally as the match works.
By Dianne Connor, St.Christophers School.
